newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Yiu Wing in HK$50 mln share placement.
newsitem.headline: Yiu Wing in HK$50 mln share placement.

text.p: Yiu Wing International Holdings Ltd said on Wednesday it agreed to place 43.10 million new shares, or 8.1 percent of the enlarged share capital, to independent investors at a price of HK$1.18 per share.

It said net proceeds of about HK$50.50 million from the placement will be used to repay the outstanding principal of HK$49.99 million on a HK$60 million convertible redeemable note due on December 18.
The note was issued to a wholly owned subsidiary of Cheung Kong (Holdings) Ltd, Yiu Wing said.
The construction and property investment group said it would place 29.10 million shares to Wang Jian Guo and 14 million shares to Cheung Kee.

The shareholdings of Wang and Cheung Kee, independent investors in Yiu Wing, will be increased to 6.5 percent and 5.0 percent, respectively, from 1.1 percent and 2.6 percent on completion of the deal on December 18.
Yiu Wing shares were at HK$1.39 per share at midday on Wednesday, up HK$0.05 from Tuesday's close.

"The investors will hold the placing shares as a long-term investment and have undertaken not to sell or transfer the placing shares within one year after completion of the placing," Yiu Wing chairman Cheung Yiu Wing said in the statement.
"No change in the management of the company is expected," he added.

The chairman's stake in Yiu Wing will be diluted to 22.5 percent from 24.5 percent following the deal, managing director Cheng Chao Ming's shareholding will be reduced to 14.3 percent from 15.6 percent, and director Cheung Kung Tai's stake will be cut to 12.4 percent from 13.5 percent.
